Young Investigator Day 2024

course-yid2024.Rmd

Workshop: Genetic relatedness

  • Date: Monday 14th of October, 2024
  • Where: Cancer Registry of Norway
  • Teacher: Magnus Dehli Vigeland

Description

The study of pedigrees and genetic relatedness is central in forensic genetics. The aim of this course is to introduce the elegant statistical foundations of relatedness, and various relevant software tools.

The workshop will alternate between lectures and hands-on exercises. Some exercises use R, while others use QuickPed, a free online tool for creating pedigrees and computing relatedness: https://magnusdv.shinyapps.io/quickped

The course material is based on the book Pedigree Analysis in R (Vigeland ’21), which may be a point of reference for participants who want to delve deeper into the subject.

Learning outcome

After completing the course the participants will have knowledge about:

  • Classical concepts of statistical genetics and relatedness analysis
  • How to produce informative and beautiful pedigree plots
  • How to compute coefficients of relatedness
  • Why some siblings are more related than others

Prerequisites

  • Basic knowledge of genetics and probability
  • All participants must bring a laptop with a recent version of R installed (at least 4.3.0)
  • I strongly recommend running R from RStudio

Schedule

The workshop is run as a half-day course, from 12 to 16, with the following (tentative) schedule:

  • 12:00–13:00 Lecture 1. Introduction to pedigrees, QuickPed and R
  • 13:00–13:45 Exercises
  • 13:45–14:00 Break
  • 14:00–15:00 Lecture 2. Measures of relatedness
  • 15:00–15:45 Exercises
  • 15:45–16:00 Summary and discussion

Comments and questions may be sent to magnusdv at gmail dot com.
